purpleculture_pinyin:
dǎng
to resist; to obstruct; to hinder; to keep off; to block (a blow); to get in the way of; cover; gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)
сопротивляться; препятствовать; препятствовать; держаться подальше; заблокировать (удар); встать на пути; крышка; передача (например, в трансмиссии автомобиля)

dàng
to arrange; to put in order
устроить; привести в порядок

heisig_chinese_memo: Fingers work as a repellent when you need to fend off bugs outside.
Ru_trainchinese:
dǎng: (глаг) преграждать, заслонять, загораживать
dǎng: (сущ) (авто) передача, скорость
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you work as a laborer outside with your fingers, you will always have to fend off bugs as they buzz in and  bother you.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand ", " when " sound. This is " dang ", and the " hand " is added next to it to indicate resistance and obstruction. "Jade articles. "Hand": "Block, block." For example, Chapter 9 of "Romance of the Three Kingdoms": "To Beiyemen, the army and soldiers are all blocking the door, and there are more than 20 people in the unique imperial cart." Kong Shangren in the Qing Dynasty "Peach Blossom Fan. "Xiuzha": "Those verbal words that respond to changes, the brawn strength of pushing left and right, are still somewhat."

The extension of " blocking " means sheltering, such as "shielding wind and rain." It also refers to objects that can be covered, such as "The Romance of the Gods" Chapter 34: "The gold bricks are not covered everywhere, and the universe is mixed with the sky."

" Block " also means clearance. For example, Chapter 6 of "A Brief History of Civilization": "According to me, let's take advantage of this block and get him two."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand ", " when " sound. This is " dang ", and the " hand " is added next to it to indicate resistance and obstruction.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「當」聲。本作「當」，後增「手」旁，表示抵擋、阻攔。《玉篇．手部》：「擋，摒擋。」如《三國演義》第9回：「到北掖門，軍兵盡擋在門外，獨有御車二十餘人同入。」清代孔尚任《桃花扇．修札》：「那些隨機應變的口頭，左衝右擋的膂力，都還有些兒。」

　　「擋」引申表示遮蔽，如「遮風擋雨」。又指可以遮蔽的物件，如《封神演義》第34回：「金磚到處無遮擋，乾坤圈配混天綾。」

　　「擋」還表示間隙。如《文明小史》第6回：「依我說，還是趁這個擋裏，弄他兩個。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「當」聲。本作「當」，後增「手」旁，表示抵擋、阻攔。

HSK: 5
Chinese: Fingers work as a repellent when you need to fend off bugs outside.
Meaning: fend off
Hanzi: 挡
Story: If you work as a laborer outside with your fingers, you will always have to fend off bugs as they buzz in and bother you.
Kind: traditional
從「 手 」，「 當 」聲。本作「 當 」，後增「 手 」旁，表示抵擋、阻攔。《玉篇．手部》：「擋，摒擋。」如《三國演義》第9回：「到北掖門，軍兵盡擋在門外，獨有御車二十餘人同入。」清代孔尚任《桃花扇．修札》：「那些隨機應變的口頭，左衝右擋的膂力，都還有些兒。」 「 擋 」引申表示遮蔽，如「遮風擋雨」。又指可以遮蔽的物件，如《封神演義》第34回：「金磚到處無遮擋，乾坤圈配混天綾。」 「 擋 」還表示間隙。如《文明小史》第6回：「依我說，還是趁這個擋裏，弄他兩個。」
From the " hand", " when" sound. This is " dang", and the " hand" is added next to it to indicate resistance and obstruction. "Jade articles. "Hand": "Block, block." For example, Chapter 9 of "Romance of the Three Kingdoms": "To Beiyemen, the army and soldiers are all blocking the door, and there are more than 20 people in the unique imperial cart." Kong Shangren in the Qing Dynasty "Peach Blossom Fan. "Xiuzha": "Those verbal words that respond to changes, the brawn strength of pushing left and right, are still somewhat." The extension of " blocking" means sheltering, such as "shielding wind and rain." It also refers to objects that can be covered, such as "The Romance of the Gods" Chapter 34: "The gold bricks are not covered everywhere, and the universe is mixed with the sky." " Block" also means clearance. For example, Chapter 6 of "A Brief History of Civilization": "According to me, let's take advantage of this block and get him two."

擋字的基本解释

擋
dǎng

擋
dàng
均见“挡”。

擋字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dǎng］
“挡1”的繁体字。
(1)阻拦。
(2)遮蔽。
(3)抵挡。
(4)间隙。
(5)拦水坝。
(6)排挡（用于改变牵引力的装置）的简称。亦指某些仪器和测量装置用来表明光、电、热等量的等级。
[②]［dàng］
［《廣韻》丁浪切，去宕，端。］
“挡2”的繁体字。
见“摒擋”。

擋字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　擋； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页458第11
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?丁浪切，當去聲。摒擋也。亦作屛當。【晉書·阮孚傳】祖約，性好財，正料財物，客至，屏當不盡。

擋字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
擋字的起名意思

暂无。

block
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dǎng］
Traditional Chinese characters for "block 1".
(1) Block.
(2) Shading.
(3) Resist.
(4) Gap.
(5) Dams.
(6) Short for gear (a device used to change traction). It also refers to certain instruments and measuring devices used to indicate the level of light, electricity, and heat.
[②]［dàng］
["Guangyun" Ding Lang cut, go down, end. ]
"Block 2" in traditional characters.
See "Rejection".
